title: Firefox not opening ( Even after doing everything prescribed on the official website
content:
Hi, I have an hp-14dk0501AU with Ryzen 5 3500U and 8gb Ram and Windows 11.

I just have installed Firefox but the app keeps on crashing. It was even crashing during the first run. It doesn't show any messages just a transparent frame after which it automatically closes. I tried every thing i.e flushed my dns , checked for virus, Turned of internet security software and all other prescribed in the official website as well as in various youtube videos. I even have reset my pc but the problem persist. I have a similar problem with opera too but chrome and brave work just fine. I tried opening it in safe mode too but it also crashes without any messages.
creator: Unleasher

title: How to get rid of "You have chosen to open" pop-up?
content: This pop-up opens when I download any file. I have tried to go to about:config, but couldn't find browser.download.manager.showAlertOnComplete. How do I get rid of it?
creator: jupiter88110

title: Suddenly Lost all bookmarks
content:
I lost all the bookmarks suddenly where i was using this browser for office work, there was no action taken from my end like deletion or any upgrade, however suddenly when i start machine today, i found all bookmarks lost. To restore backup I entered to Profile --> bookmark backup this file is extension JSONLZ4 which is not visible during restore bookmark.

This is quite important to recover these suddenly lost all bookmarks, so is there any way or support available?

Unfortunately this is first time i am facing such kind of issue, So kindly also let me know if we should trust mozilla firefox as default browser and to save bookmarks?

Thanks & Regards
creator: deepak.fojdar

title: Insecure Connection for actual secure site
content:
Hi

Up to a few hours ago, I have been able to access a secure state school website on my mobile phone. However suddenly I cannot and receive following: "connection not secure" and "address not found". I have tried turning phone off, checking that Firefox is updated (was last updated 21 Oct and cited as up-to-date), disabling security app - all to no avail.

I need access to this site. Please assist.

Yours faithfully
creator: catherinecolettel

title: Lentitud del navegador
content: Llevo ya años usando Firefox como navegador predeterminado, pero desde hace ya varios días está demasiado lento. Tanto, que he decidido temporalmente cambiar mi navegador predeterminado (por lo pronto uso Explorer) Hasta ahora he revisado todos los detalles que acá se indican para resolver el problema (uso la última versión, los drivers están actualizados, nada de malwares, etc... de hecho, Explorer navega fluídamente), así que asumo es algún inconveniente no atribuible a lo allí citado. Por otra parte, desde hace mucho también uso el complemento AIO Search, pero ahora tampoco funciona con este Firefox. En Explorer sí está funcionando. La verdad me gustaría recuperar la rapidez de Firefox, pues hasta ahora siempre ha sido mi favorito
creator: alfredo.rdelgado

title: Hidden browser window?
content:
Firefox 93.0 64bit Linux Mint 1.0

When I close (X) the window, my session is not restored. I have checked all the settings and verified that they are set correctly. Then, I found that when I tried to quit the program via File menu, it says that I have two windows and three tabs open, yet I only have on window/one tab open. I can not find this other window... What does this mean? Have tried refreshing the app, safe mode, and disabling the extensions that I use.

Thanks!
creator: darkmetal262

creator: peterphillips21

title: Having to fix FF93 problem only with Windows Recovery
content:
FF 93.0 64-bit - Windows 10

When I booted up the system and ran FF the first time for the day, its window opened, and it even asked for the primary password. After that, nothing I typed in the URL box came out. I could open new tabs but not able to switch to them. All Chromium-based browsers and Edge in the same system worked fine.

I did the following trying to fix the problem: I restarted Win10 and ran FF93. Same problem. I restarted using Troubleshooting Mode. Same problem. I reinstalled using the complete package. Same problem. I installed using FF92 and FF91. Same problem. I refreshed FF93 using Troubleshooting Mode. Same problem. I used Win10 Safe Mode to run FF93. It worked. I uninstalled FF93, removed as much as I could all traces of FF and Mozilla in the Win registry, and reinstalled FF93. Same problem.

In the end, I had to use Win10 Recovery and revert to an earlier date to fix it.

The first incident happened about two weeks ago. It happened again this morning. My use of PC has been routine for years, I would say for more than a decade, or at least in the last five years. No extraordinary applications or routines.

BTW, I haven't updated my Win10 in years, because doing so often times gave me new mysterious issues to troubleshoot, courtesy of MS. You should very well know Win updates produce issues, and the bug fixes following them produce even more. The annoying thing is I would research on the issues and find out later (sometimes days) that the updates were the culprits.

This is the second time it happened to my FF93, and I feel I have to report this to get some idea about why this is happening (only to me?) and how to fix or prevent it without having to go into Recovery (again?).
creator: mobilesuit600
